Tucson felt that somehow he could trust Big Convoy.  With sincerity he look=
s to him.  A look often expressed by someone of wisdom and someone who was =
willing to help when others would just turn their back.  

" I was appointe=
d a Prime unexpectedly.  A while ago, I had just learned of Rodimus being a=
bducted by Predacon forces, as I too have just recently returned to the Ark=
.  I went to visit our fallen leader, Optimus Prime, and asked Primus for h=
is help to recover Rodimus.  And before I knew it, I was upgraded to a Prim=
e.  Before that, I attempted to rescue Rodimus myself. No matter the risk, =
I knew I had to put his safety ahead of my own.  I would do it again and I =
will.  My purpose is to protect the innocent, even if it is of great risk t=
o my own life.  Tell me, what brings you to a place like this?  You seem to=
 be more understanding than the usual lot."

He walks with Big Convoy, as i=
f walking beside Lord Elder.

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. =

insolence and I myself am not a fan of it. My name is Tucson Prime. I

aximal Prime. "

espectfully. His vocal

" I'm ready Sir."
>

esigned tones. He shook his
> head as he gestured for TUSCON to follow him.=
 "This must be your first
> trip into the pens?"
> 
> Behind TUSCOn the sou=
nd of the gate closing could be heard and the low
> wine of an energy field=
 snapping into place could be just discerned to
> those with superior heari=
ng.
>

You
> seem to be too young to be a Prime." Then he shrugged, "Then again
> =
Prime's do seem to be getting younger and younger with each passing
> vorn.=

 No matter the risk, I knew I had to put his safety ahead of my own.  =
